description: From Middle English formelten, from Old English formeltan (“to melt away, dissolve, liquefy, burn up”), equivalent to for- +‎ melt. Compare German verschmelzen, Dutch versmelten.

verbs.description: formelt (third-person singular simple present formelts, present participle formelting, simple past formelted or formolt, past participle formelted or formolten)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To melt; melt away; dissolve.
examples: Loue's vshering fire Foremelting beautie, and loue's flame itselfe.
